Kevin and Anita Crawford and their 20-year-old daughter Kirsten were killed Feb. 16, 2017, after their vehicle was struck. Investigators say driver Piotr Rog, 21, was at fault in the crash. A 21-year-old driver with a history of speeding may have been traveling faster than 100 mph in a 40 mph zone when he slammed into another car in Des Plaines , killing himself and three members of a close-knit local family, officials said Friday. 
After the wreckage cleared, a veteran suburban police... (Karen Ann Cullotta) 
Before the service was held, Christian broke into a smile as he was greeted by 10 visiting golden retriever dogs in the parking lot outside the church. 
The comfort dogs were provided by Lutheran Church Charities' K-9 Comfort Dogs, a Northbrook-based ministry that also has supported grieving families after the shootings at Sandy Hook Elementary School in Newtown, Conn., and Pulse nightclub in Orlando. 
"Each situation is different, but the mercy and compassion provided by these dogs helps those who are dealing with a terrible loss," said Tim Hetzner, president of the comfort dogs group. 
Andrew Cornell, a close friend of the Crawford family and director of coaching at the Mount Prospect-based Chicago Fire Juniors Gold, a youth soccer club founded by Kevin Crawford, said he initially had hoped to speak at the funeral service. 
But as the morning approached, Cornell told Gavin that he was "too broken" by the death of his friends and asked if the pastor could read aloud his statement. 
"I've had my family cut in half," Cornell wrote. "They took me into their house and treated me like 'Andy Crawford.' I'm still in disbelief that such a tragedy could happen, and I truly can't understand why."
